alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 12:34PM PST until December 30 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM FRIDAY TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations 2 to 6 inches, with up to 12 inches above 7500 feet elevation, west of Highway 89. It will be a mix of rain and snow in the Tahoe Basin at the storm onset, changing to mainly snow Saturday. This will greatly limit totals with a dusting up to 2 inches near 6000 feet elevation. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph along the Sierra crest with up to 35 mph into the Basin. Wave heights on Lake Tahoe 1 to 3 feet. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 10 PM Friday to 4 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will deteriorate Friday night for Sierra passes, with difficult travel throughout the Greater Tahoe region by Saturday morning. Winds could cause damage to any unsecured holiday decorations. Rough waters Friday afternoon into Saturday morning for Lake Tahoe.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or checking with CalTrans Quickmap in California or NDOT NV Roads in Nevada.
